hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Selloff
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a sharp (>5%) intraday drop on negative macro news (US budget/debt ceiling), but aggregate exchange order book depth recovers to >90% of pre-drop levels within 4 hours, a mean reversion bounce of 2-3% will occur within the next 12 trading hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Recent budget crisis news caused sharp drops but liquidity quickly recovered, suggesting algorithmic overreaction. Market makers reload books when volatility spikes aren't sustained, creating temporary mispricing.
entry_conditions: BTC 4h candle closes >5% below previous close
Negative macro news headline confirmed (US budget/debt ceiling related)
Aggregate BTC order book depth (sum of top 20 bids/asks across major exchanges) recovers to >90% of pre-drop level
Funding rates turn negative but less than -0.02% (no extreme fear)
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such events result in continued decline beyond 5% below entry, or liquidity fails to sustain recovery for 6+ hours.
